alert.note: Alert for Bayfield; Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 18 at 1:55PM CST until February 18 at 2:15PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN CARLTON...WEST CENTRAL BAYFIELD AND CENTRAL DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 154 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Oulu, to near Foxboro, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Extremely poor visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This affects US Highway 2 from near Superior to Iron River and US Highway 53 from near Superior and Solon Springs. Locations impacted include... Superior, Hawthorne, Iron River, Lake Nebagamon, Maple, Brule, Poplar, Solon Springs, Oulu, Holyoke, South Range, Foxboro, Bennett, Cloverland, Wentworth, Amnicon Lake, Chaffey, Amnicon Falls State Park, Pattison State Park, and Blueberry. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.
